But when the next morning they left me, and returned to their own monastery of Lindisfarne, behold, they found that one of their members had died of the plague3 which increased and raged for days and months, until within the year almost the whole of that noble company of fathers and brethren had departed to the Lord ¹.’

No doubt this monastic life had, like everything human, its seamy side.
